p: Dihydroisocoumarin mellein derives its name from a strain of Aspergillus melleus, which is the first reported source of mellein [ 126]. Later, this compound was found in plants such as Moringa and Stevia [ 127, 128]. Mellein has exhibited antimicrobial and anti-schistosomiasis activities [ 114, 115]. Mellein has been reported from endophytic fungal species Septoria nodorum in 1995 by Findlay et al. followed by dozens of similar reports as listed in Table 2 [ 108].
